judgement.reason: An antiviral is a type of treatment or medication, whereas an antiviral agent specifically refers to the substance or compound used to inhibit the growth of viruses. Not all antivirals are agents, as the term 'antiviral' can also refer to broader strategies or mechanisms.
antiviral agent and antiviral agent are identical terms

An antiviral is a type of medication or treatment that combats viruses, while an antiviral agent specifically refers to the substance or compound that has antiviral properties. Not all antivirals are referred to as agents, as the term 'antiviral' can also encompass broader concepts like strategies or measures.
The terms 'Antiviral agent' and 'antiviral agent' are identical except for capitalization, implying they refer to the same concept without exceptions.

antiviral refers to anything that acts against viruses, whereas an antiviral agent specifically refers to a substance or compound that inhibits the growth of viruses. Not all antivirals are agents as antiviral can also refer to actions or mechanisms.
Both terms are identical and refer to the same concept.
antiviral and antiviral agent are synonyms as both refer to substances that inhibit the growth of viruses

An antiviral is a substance or treatment that combats viruses, while an antiviral agent specifically refers to a substance used to inhibit the growth or replication of viruses. Not all antivirals are agents, as the term 'antiviral' can also refer to broader therapeutic approaches.
antiviral agent and antiviral agent are identical terms

Both terms are identical and refer to the same concept.
